docs.snippet: A ban on privately financed travel is likely to be unpopular with many lawmakers as well as a variety of special-interest groups....
docs.lead_paragraph: House Republicans assembling a package of proposed changes in lobbying rules are contemplating a ban on all travel underwritten by outside groups, the lawmaker who is leading the effort said Tuesday. The lawmaker, Representative David Dreier of California, chairman of the Rules Committee, said Speaker J. Dennis Hastert has endorsed the idea of prohibiting members of Congress and their aides from accepting trips not paid for out of Congressional budgets.

headline.main: House G.O.P. Considers Ban on Lobby-Paid Travel

docs.snippet: WARSAW, Sunday, March 6 (AP)--Premier Jozef Cyrankiewicz warned last night that Stefan Cardinal Wyszynski and other Polish Roman Catholic bishops will be barred from foreign travel "so long as they do not change their disloyal attitude toward the ...
docs.lead_paragraph: WARSAW, Sunday, March 6 (AP)--Premier Jozef Cyrankiewicz warned last night that Stefan Cardinal Wyszynski and other Polish Roman Catholic bishops will be barred from foreign travel "so long as they do not change their disloyal attitude toward the Polish People's Republic."
docs.abstract: Premier Cyrankiewicz says Cardinal Wyszynski will be barred from foreign travel so long as he maintains 'disloyal attitude'; cites appearance of anti-Communist Prof Halecki at Jan Vatican fete marking 1,000 yrs of Polish Christianity as additional reason for barring travel; Ital Communist party leader Longo charges Wyszynski dampened plans for fete

headline.main: Premier of Poland Affirms Travel Ban Against Wyszynski

docs.snippet: Govt bars USSR diplomat's trip to Harrogate in reprisal for USSR curbs on Brit diplomats in Moscow...

headline.main: Save the Tiger, Ban the Tourists

docs.snippet: Demand for travel to Cuba may be flattening, with soaring hotel prices on the island, American Airlines cutting some flights, and uncertainty over whether new travel restrictions could be imposed when Donald Trump takes office....

headline.main: Is Demand for Travel to Cuba Flattening?
headline.print_headline: Is Demand for Travel to Cuba Flattening?

docs.snippet: The Soviet dissident Andrei D. Sakharov, to win permission for his wife to go to the West for medical treatment, accepted a ban on his own departure, a relative said today.   ''He felt that the request made by the K.G.B. was a condition for Yelena...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Soviet dissident Andrei D. Sakharov, to win permission for his wife to go to the West for medical treatment, accepted a ban on his own departure, a relative said today. ''He felt that the request made by the K.G.B. was a condition for Yelena to go abroad for medical treatment,'' said the relative, Efrem Yankelevich, son-in-law of Dr. Sakharov's wife, Yelena G. Bonner.

headline.main: SAKHAROV SAID TO ACCEPT EXIT BAN

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, April 17--The State Department has eased its visa restrictions against former or current members of totalitarian organizations. The new rules exempt persons who joined involuntarily or who were not 16 years of age when they were member...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, April 17--The State Department has eased its visa restrictions against former or current members of totalitarian organizations. The new rules exempt persons who joined involuntarily or who were not 16 years of age when they were members.
docs.abstract: US lifting of visa curbs enables many war brides to enter

headline.main: VISA BAN IS LIFTED FOR 300,000 ABROAD

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: Although slightly loosening its restrictions, Israel reaffirmed an entry ban today that has kept tens of thousands of Palestinians from work since Islamic suicide bombers killed 21 Israelis two weeks ago.   At its weekly meeting, the Government ag...
docs.lead_paragraph: Although slightly loosening its restrictions, Israel reaffirmed an entry ban today that has kept tens of thousands of Palestinians from work since Islamic suicide bombers killed 21 Israelis two weeks ago. At its weekly meeting, the Government agreed to a list of exceptions to a territorial closing that has prevented Palestinians from crossing from the West Bank and Gaza Strip into Israel, even to reach Arab neighborhoods in Jerusalem that they regard as their cultural and business centers.

headline.main: Israel Eases Palestinian Entry Ban, but Refuses to Scrap It

docs.snippet: Cuba reversed a decades-long policy on Friday that prevented Cuban-born people from traveling to or from the island by ship....
docs.lead_paragraph: Cuba reversed a decades-long policy on Friday that prevented Cuban-born people from traveling to or from the island by ship.
docs.abstract: Cuba lifts restriction that barred Cubans from entering or exiting country via cruise ship or commercial vessel, reversal of decades-old policy; decision comes in wake of announcement by Carnival Cruise Line that it would delay inaugural cruise to country if police remained in effect.

headline.main: Cuba Eases Decades-long Restriction on Sea Travel
headline.print_headline: Cuba Reverses Longtime Ban on Sea Travel
